meanings.definition: A cell, group of cells, or organism that is produced asexually from and is genetically identical to a single ancestor.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the clones of the plant to understand genetic similarities.
meanings.sent2: The clones of the sheep were identical in appearance and genetic makeup.
meanings.sent3: The clones of the fruit flies were so alike, they even had the same favorite foods!
meanings.sent4: In the field of genetics, clones are like nature's identical twins.
meanings.sent5: The concept of clones helps us explore the idea of genetic replication.

meanings.definition: To produce a copy or imitation of.
meanings.sent1: The artist decided to clones his famous painting for a limited edition series.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to clones the recipe exactly as her grandmother had taught her.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he could clones his friend's dance moves but with less finesse.
meanings.sent4: The company aimed to clones the success of their previous product launch.
meanings.sent5: The software allows users to easily clones files for backup purposes.
